newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RBNZ to buy back T-bills to manage liquidity.
newsitem.headline: RBNZ to buy back T-bills to manage liquidity.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand said on Friday it was offering to buy back Treasury bills maturing January 8 and January 15, 1997, for value December 20, 1996.
It said the buy-back was a result of a large non-tax revenue payment to the Crown on December 20.
"Additionally, the bank will most likely offer to buy back the above January Treasury bills in the Open Market Operation of 20 December 1996," the RBNZ said.
